title: How to Connect a Honeywell Thermostat to WiFi

steps.title: Tap Menu on the thermostat.
steps.content: Tap Menu on the thermostat. You'll see this to the right of the display screen next to Home , Fan , and System .

steps.title: Tap Wi-Fi Setup.
steps.content: Tap Wi-Fi Setup . You'll then see a list of available Wi-Fi networks.

steps.title: Tap your network.
steps.content: Tap your network. You can use the arrow buttons to see more of the list of networks.

steps.title: Type your Wi-Fi password (if needed), then tap Done.
steps.content: Type your Wi-Fi password (if needed), then tap Done . If you didn't change your router's password and have forgotten it, you can most likely find it on a sticker on your router.

steps.title: Tap Next.
steps.content: Tap Next . If your thermostat connects successfully to your Wi-Fi network, you'll see a confirmation page and you're done. If the connection was unsuccessful, make sure you've typed in the correct password. You can also try disconnecting the thermostat and reconnecting it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Put your thermostat in "Wi-Fi Setup" mode.
steps.content: Put your thermostat in "Wi-Fi Setup" mode. If you see "Wi-Fi Setup" displayed on the screen, you can skip to the next step. Press the FAN button and the UP arrow, then release them when you see a set of numbers. Press the NEXT button to change the number on the left to 39 and press the DOWN arrow to change the number on the right to 0. [2] X Research source Press the DONE button to return to the main screen on the thermostat.

steps.title: Open Wi-Fi settings on your phone or computer.
steps.content: Open Wi-Fi settings on your phone or computer. You should find a network that your thermostat is sending.

steps.title: Connect to the Wi-Fi network similar to "NewThermostat.
steps.content: Connect to the Wi-Fi network similar to "NewThermostat. " If you don't know how to connect to a wireless network, refer to How to Connect to a Wireless Internet Connection . Generally, you need to tap on the network name to connect.

steps.title: Open a web browser.
steps.content: Open a web browser. If you're on your phone or computer, you should be redirected to a list of available networks to which you can connect your thermostat's network. If you aren't automatically redirected to the Wi-Fi setup page, go to http://192.168.1.1.

steps.title: Select your home's network, enter the password, and then tap Connect.
steps.content: Select your home's network, enter the password, and then tap Connect . If you don't have a network set up, refer to How to Set up a Wireless Network (WiFi) Connection .

steps.title: Check your thermostat screen.
steps.content: Check your thermostat screen. It'll display a "Wait" message until it has connected to your WiFi. You can either control it from Total Connect Comfort's website or the mobile app. The thermostat's display will show you the Wi-Fi signal strength in the upper right corner of the display screen.
